page.title: 15A SCHOOL HISTORY ERDINGTON
page.content: Wylde Green School was founded in 1838 and in 1840 it was converted into a Boys' School. 2 teachers, Mr. & Mrs. James Cramp, took up residence in the school house. In 1842 a uniform was adopted and in 1948 it was added to with a blue two-piece suit. Plans drawn up in 1905 show that 2 classrooms were added. The total of boys in the school was 52, their ages ranging from 6 to 13. In 1928 the library was added to the school building and the school progressed steadily through the years. In 1894 the boys in Standard 1 form, formed 3 groups. 7 boys that could not make figures had to be taught addition. The numbers of Wylde Green swellled and 2 more teachers were called in to help with the education of 130 boys. Girls were now attending. In 1985 the school held a Victorian day.
